result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Trenten G. Ploederl

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Trenten G. Ploederl
Current: 2007 14th Street, Two Rivers, WI 54241 United States  (Effective: 10-24-2022)
Prior: 2007 14th Street, Two Rivers, WI 54241 United States

2:14 PM Defendant Trenten G. Ploederl in court. Special appearance by Attorney Luke K Harrison in court for Trenten G Ploederl.  Prosecuting attorney Marconi De Franca Barros in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Public Defender has not appointed counsel for the defendant and requests more time to do so. The matter is adjourned. 
Bail is set at $5000  recognizance bond with the condition that he is to have no contact with L.E. or anyone under the age of 18 except for incidental contact. The defendant must also report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 48 hours, or if incarcerated, within 72 hours of release.  Bail furnished.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
